alert.note: Alert for Taney (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 17 at 5:23PM CDT until July 17 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM CDT FOR WESTERN OZARK AND SOUTHEASTERN TANEY COUNTIES... At 522 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 10 miles west of Gainesville to near Price Place to near Ozark Isle to 6 miles east of Lead Hill, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. Numerous reports of trees and powerlines down have been observed in eastern Taney and western Ozark counties. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Bull Shoals Lake, Gainesville, Theodosia, Pontiac, Sundown, Hardenville, Protem, Thornfield, Rueter, Willhoit, Long Run and Isabella. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
